elements.title: coins featuring emperor Yuan Shikai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Republic of China produced coins featuring emperor Yuan Shikai (pictured) for decades after his demise?

elements.title: Armond Seidler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Armond Seidler invented the pugil stick for military training purposes, it later found use in the television show American Gladiators?

elements.title: You're More Beautiful Than a Rose (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two cosmetic companies engaged in a "rose war" with advertising campaigns based around the song "You're More Beautiful Than a Rose" and the film The Rose of Versailles?

elements.title: Fede Vigevani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fede Vigevani once presented an awards ceremony in which he won an award?

elements.title: Jubilee Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the construction of the Jubilee Bridge was featured in the 1982 documentary about the A9 road reconstruction?

elements.title: Edmilson Pedro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic judoka Edmilson Pedro is nicknamed Bicho Papão, which means "the bogeyman"?

elements.title: Bergdorf Goodman Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "New York's wealthiest janitor" lived atop the Bergdorf Goodman Building?

elements.title: Henry Charles Swan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Henry Charles Swan, a law graduate from Oxford, spent more than 25 years living on a yacht in a stream in New Zealand?

elements.title: Slim Pickins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in her song "Slim Pickins", Sabrina Carpenter supposedly settles for someone who does not know the difference between "their", "there", and "they are"?
